intro: Lasiolaena pereirae, commonly known as the Peruvian grass, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with pale green to brown florets, typical of many grass species. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
